definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Even the celestial world is heavily guarded.
sentences.chinese: 神仙世界也是戒備森嚴的。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, there were no signs of tension along the heavily fortified land border separating the two Koreas.
sentences.chinese: 同時，戒備森嚴的兩國陸地邊界附近沒有緊張的跡象。

sentences.english: These areas become well-guarded bunkers, or silos.
sentences.chinese: 這些勢力範圍成爲戒備森嚴的碉堡或者筒倉。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
Liehyu township in Kinmen County 金門縣|金门县[Jin1 men2 xian4] (Kinmen or Quemoy islands), Taiwan
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
Zhuangwei or Chuangwei township in Yilan county 宜蘭縣|宜兰县[Yi2 lan2 xian4], Taiwan
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
